metadata.name: Is this role being posted for the immigration team?

title: Associate Director, Category Management
content:
Our Opportunity:
Chewy is hiring an Associate Director of Category Management of Emerging Food Forms. The successful candidate will be a self-starter and focus on building a new business from the ground up through developing new business relationship, expanding selection and managing multiple new product launches on Chewy. The ideal candidate will have excellent verbal and written communication, strong negotiations and vendor manager experience, the ability to analyze and communicate complex terms, margin structure and work well across other teams including Finance, Inventory Management, and Site Experience. In addition, The successful candidate will have demonstrated the ability to lead small teams, as this will be a manager role over a team of 2-3.. Keys to success also include strong ownership values, a passion for innovation, and hustle. The location can be based out of Seattle or Florida.
 
What You’ll Do:

Manage a high growth business across a diverse group of brands
Help launch new
Prepare the Merchandising department build a new business and scale 4x current volume
Work in conjunction with the Business Vertical VPs to develop goals for the Category Management team
Ensure Merchandising is planning and delivering on all key P/L Metrics
Negotiate highly complex deal structures across vendor partners with a focus on long term growth and scale
Develop strategies across marketing, product and supply chain to lead the growth for a new, complex business format on Chewy
Collaborate with cross-functional partners across businesses to execute the strategy effectively, both Delivery Experience, Marketing, Supply chain and Finance
Interject new insights and ideas for improving customer experience and improving financials while holding true to Chewy fundamentals
Position may require travel

What You'll Need:

Minimum of 8+ years in buying, account management, product management, project management, financial analysis and/or marketing.
Alternate profile- Willing to consider candidates with less experience who have advanced degrees and are working for top consulting firms.
Minimum of 8 years negotiation experience
Manager experience of a small team
Ecommerce experience preferred
Strong in Excel
BA/BS (MBA preferred)
Position may require travel

Bonus:

An accomplished range of skill from high-level strategic thinking to working with external partners.
Demonstrated excellent business judgment with strong written and oral communication skills.
Strong analytical abilities and problem-solving skills
The ability to use both formal and informal influencing skills across Chewy’s cross-matrix organization is critical to success in this role.

#LI-BB2Chewy is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity and inclusion of all Team Members. If you have a disability under the Americans with Disabilities Act or similar law, and you need an accommodation during the application process or to perform these job requirements, or if you need a religious accommodation, please contact CAAR@chewy.com.
 
If you have a question regarding your application, please contact HR@chewy.com.
 
To access Chewy's Customer Privacy Policy, please click here. To access Chewy's California CPRA Job Applicant Privacy Policy, please click here.

You may opt out of these messages at any time by replying 'STOP' to any text messages you receive.

Arbitration Agreement Signed?
Arbitration Agreement Signed Date

Deloitte is Chewy’s independent auditor. To not impair Deloitte's independence, Chewy must validate the role of any current or former Deloitte employee against any exempt role they are interviewing for at Chewy. Do you currently work for Deloitte or have you ever been employed by Deloitte in the past?

Close family ties to a Deloitte employee could also impair Deloitte’s independence as Chewy’s auditor should you become employed by Chewy.  Do you have a close family member (spouse or equivalent, parent, dependent, non-dependent child, and/or sibling) that currently works for Deloitte?
